sense.def:
To settle an argument
pomeni končati spor ali prepir.

seg.quote: The strike went on for over a year before it was finally settled.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
is settled
, se o tistem dogovorimo ali za tisto najdemo rešitev.

To settle a bill
pomeni plačati račun.

To settle somewhere
pomeni začeti nekje stalno živeti.

gramGrp.pos:
REFL VB
or
VB
with
ADJUNCT

sense.def:
To settle oneself somewhere
ali
to settle somewhere
pomeni nekam udobno sesti.

seg.quote: He settled himself beside her in the car.
Casson took off his raincoat and settled before the fire.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
settles
, počasi pada in na koncu obmiruje.

seg.quote: The hull of the boat slowly settled in the mud.

sense.def:
Kadar ptice ali žuželke
settle on something
, se na nekaj spustijo in tam obmirujejo.

seg.quote: ...flies and other insects that settle on plants growing on the banks.

sense.def:
To settle down to something
pomeni, da se nekdo pripravi in osredotoči na neko delo.

seg.quote: ...before they settle down to university work.
He had settled down to watch a sports programme.

sense.def:
To settle down
pomeni začeti mirno živeti na nekem kraju, zlasti kadar se poročimo ali kupimo hišo.

seg.quote: You should get a job and settle down.

sense.def:
To settle down
pomeni, da nekdo, ki je razburjen ali hrupen, postane miren in tih.

To settle for something
pomeni nekaj izbrati ali sprejeti, zlasti kadar si v resnici ne želimo tistega, pač pa nekaj drugega, kar ni na voljo.

seg.quote: When in doubt he settled for hamburgers.

sense.def:
To settle in
pomeni postopoma se počutiti vedno bolj domače v novem kraju ali na novem delovnem mestu.

seg.quote: And how are you settling in, Mr Swallow?

sense.def:
To settle on a particular thing
pomeni izbrati nekaj po daljšem razmišljanju o drugih možnostih.

seg.quote: Have you settled on a name for him yet?

sense.def:
To settle up
pomeni plačati račun.
